alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 11:45AM EDT until April 29 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the Broad River In SC affecting Cherokee County... ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Broad River In SC Near Blacksburg. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...Between 14 and 15 feet, minor flooding of low-lying farmland along the river is ongoing. Areas along Buffalo Creek may be flooding due to backwater effects. The Broad River may approach River and Little Hope Roads near US 29. Also, continue to monitor high water levels downstream into Ninety-Nine Islands. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 14.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage by this evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp
